events.title: R.A.S.C. Drivers' Diligence Ensures Critical Deployment Completion Amidst Challenges on October 13, 1944
events.description: For .a .vatiety of causes, many -beyond our rontrol, the deployment was not completed till 13th October, 1944. Even this date would not have been achieved but for the excellent work of the R.A.S.C. drivers who drove both themselves and some of their transport to a

events.title: British Torpedo Squadrons Handed Over to Russia as Ships Set Sail for Crews and Supplies
events.description: 1, After the passages of P.Q.18 and Q.P.14, the two squadrons of Hampden torpedo aircraft which had flown to Russia for this operation were presented to the Russians. The ARGONAUT, INTREPID and OBDURATE sailed on 13th October to bring home the crews of these aircraft.   On the outward passage these ships carried the medical unit, which the Soviet Government had now .consented to allow ashore, and food for the British forces in North The Norwegian expedition in Spitzbergen had also discovered some fresh needs for the winter ; and the ships called at Barentsburg on the way.
